case_vignette: A 21-year-old male presents to the ED with a stab wound to the right neck. The patient is alert and responsive, and vital signs are stable.
question: Which  neurologic findings would most likely support the diagnosis of right-sided spinal cord hemisection?
correct_ans: right-sided tactile, vibration, and proprioception loss; left-sided pain and temperature sensation loss; right-sided paresis

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.

I got stabbed in the right side of my neck.

No, I haven't experienced any shortness of breath or difficulty swallowing.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
The case vignette does not provide any information about my medical conditions or medications.
I understand. Do you have any relevant family history of clotting disorders or bleeding tendencies?
The case vignette does not mention any family history of clotting disorders or bleeding tendencies.
I see. Are you able to move your neck without any difficulty?
Yes, I can move my neck without any difficulty.
I see. Final Diagnosis: Penetrating neck injury
